required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Study of KN046 in Combination With Lenvatinib in Advanced Hepatocellular Carcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Study Evaluating the Safety and Efficacy of KN046 in Combination With Lenvatinib in Advanced Hepatocellular Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: This ia a single-arm, not-randomized, open-label phase II study. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of KN046 (PD-L1 /CTLA-4 Bispecific antibody) combined with Lenvatinib(TKI) for the treatment of advanced hepatocellular carcinoma.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after the last patient's enrollment
primary_outcome.description: objective response rate (ORR) based on the RECIST 1.1 by investigator

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after the last patient's enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: objective response rate (ORR) based on the mRECIST 1.1 and imRECIST respectively by investigator

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after the last patient's enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: disease control rate (DCR) based on the RECIST 1.1，mRECIST 1.1 and imRECIST respectively by investigator

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after the last patient's enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: duration of response (DOR) based on the RECIST 1.1，mRECIST 1.1 and imRECIST respectively by investigator

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after the last patient's enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: time to response (TTR) based on the RECIST 1.1，mRECIST 1.1 and imRECIST respectively by investigator

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 year after the last patient's enrollment
1 year after the last patient's enrollment
2 year after the last patient's enrollment

intervention.description: Subjects enrolled in the study will be intravenously administered KN046 5mg/kg every 3 weeks (Q3W), until disease progression, or unacceptable toxicity, or withdrawal of consent, or lost to follow-up, or died, or treatment for 2 years, or the investigator decides to terminate.

Subjects enrolled in the study will receive lenvatinib 12 mg (BW≥60 kg) or 8 mg (BW<60 kg) orally once a day (QD) ,until disease progression, or unacceptable toxicity, or withdrawal of consent, or lost to follow-up, or died, or treatment for 2 years, or the investigator decides to terminate.
